com.quantcomponents.algo
Interface IPosition

All Known Implementing Classes:
PositionBean
public interface IPosition

Position information within an execution service for a specific IContract

Method Summary
 double getAveragePrice()
          The average price of the position based on execution prices and amounts while building the position from zero; positive for long positions, negative for short positions
 double getMarketPrice()
          The market price of the contract at the time of creation of this position
 double getMarketValue()
          The value of the total position at market price; positive for long positions, negative for short positions
 double getRealizedPnl()
          The realized profit or loss through the closing of previously open positions
 double getSignedAmount()
          A signed amount, positive is the position is long, negative if the position is short.
 Date getTimestamp()
          The timestamp of this position.
 double getUnrealizedPnl()
          Market value minus the average price of the position times the current amount
 

Method Detail

getTimestamp

Date getTimestamp()
The timestamp of this position. It can correspond to the instant when the position has last change, but this depends on the implementation of the position service

getSignedAmount

double getSignedAmount()
A signed amount, positive is the position is long, negative if the position is short. In case of SecurityType.CASH positions, the amount correspond to the money amount, and it can be non integer

getMarketPrice

double getMarketPrice()
The market price of the contract at the time of creation of this position

getMarketValue

double getMarketValue()
The value of the total position at market price; positive for long positions, negative for short positions

getAveragePrice

double getAveragePrice()
The average price of the position based on execution prices and amounts while building the position from zero; positive for long positions, negative for short positions

getUnrealizedPnl

double getUnrealizedPnl()
Market value minus the average price of the position times the current amount

getRealizedPnl

double getRealizedPnl()
The realized profit or loss through the closing of previously open positions
